scorings.justification: The text explicitly states that Mr. C's processing-extension certificate expired on 11 October 2024, which directly pertains to this intention.
The text clearly mentions that Mr. C wishes to submit an asylum application, indicating a strong intention to file an asylum request.
There is no mention of the status of any pending asylum application; the focus is on filing a new application.
The text does not reference the expiration of an ATDA (Asylum-Seeker Certificate), so it is not applicable in this case.
There is no indication that Mr. C is updating information related to an ATDA.
There is no mention of an ongoing Dublin procedure in the text.
This application does not relate to a Ukrainian national; hence, it is not applicable.
This does not involve a Ukrainian national requesting a renewal of their permit.
The applicant is not Ukrainian; thus, this intention does not apply.
There is no mention of a student in a mobility program.
The text does not mention any trainee attached to the medical profession.
There is no indication of difficulties with the ANEF website.
The text does not cover a change of status from student to salaried employee.
There is no mention of changing status from student to job seeker.
This intention does not apply as it involves a specific type of residence permit outside the ANEF portal.
The text does not mention any issues with creating an ANEF account.
There is no mention of encountering other blockages on the ANEF site.
The text does not mention any other ANEF-related problems.
Mr. C wishes to return to his home country for the exceptional reason of attending his fatherâ€™s funeral, which aligns perfectly with this intention.

list: Without action in the next few days, he risks losing his job.
He currently holds subsidiary protection status
